column4: Does anybody know how to configure a linux torrent client to allow you to start all downloads at a particular time, and pause them again at a particular time?
well, you could easily start it with cron or at -- pausing it is a different story -- you'd have to find out if any of the clients take signals
might want to try killing the process and see what happens ... maybe kill -1 if straight kill is too brutal...
i dont so much as understand your suggestion
hmm... do you know what the kill command does?
yes, i know how it works, but i do not know how to configure it to do so at a particular time, or how, for that matter, to start or continue a download at a particular time

this is just a theory, but it goes like this: BT clients resume your downloads when you start them up. so, to get your torrents to start at a specific time, you can start the torrent client, load it up with the torrents and have it start downloading, and then immediately quit.
now you can do something dump on the command line like: sleep $((60 * 60 * 4)) ; bittorent-client
but you can configure it to open my client at a particular time? and to kill the process at a particular time?
and in 4 hours it'll restart the client
or you can use something like at: at -f /usr/bin/bittorrent-client 10 pm
anyway, you can see the idea here
i see the idea, but i dont know how to code it ;)
well starting it up again is easy enough
this will start the client in two hours:
sleep $((60 * 60 * 2)) ; /patch/to/bittorrent-client
grabbing the PID and killing it later, are probably a bit more than i want to explain right now since I was about to make dinner :)
